Ĉi tiu leĝo difinas la gvidajn principojn por la uzo, konservado, kaj disvolviĝo de ŝtataj entreprenoj, nemoveblaĵoj, intelekta proprieto, kaj investoj. Ĝi certigas respondecon, travideblecon, kaj publikan profiton el tiuj rimedoj. Krome, ĝi establas institucion por kontroli tiujn posedojn, inkluzive de agenteco kun esplorpovoj kaj operaciaj kapabloj. La administrado de ŝtataj posedoj devas esti farita kun konsidero al daŭripova evoluo, fiskala respondeco, kaj socia egaleco.

name: Agency for the Administration of State Assets
content: This section establishes the Agency for the Administration of State Assets (AASA), a central authority responsible for the oversight, governance, and strategic development of state-owned resources. The Agency operates independently, though under the oversight of the Ministry of Economic Regulation, and is tasked with managing public enterprises, state-held shares in corporations, strategic infrastructure, and land resources owned by the state. AASA is authorized to audit asset performance, recommend privatization or investment, and ensure efficient and transparent management. It maintains a public registry of state-owned assets and regularly publishes reports to ensure accountability. The agency also has the authority to intervene in the mismanagement of assets and to coordinate with other ministries to ensure intersectoral cohesion. It is legally mandated to operate in the public interest and is protected by anti-corruption provisions.
translation: Ĉi tiu sekcio establas la Agentejon por la Administrado de Ŝtataj Posedaĵoj (AASP), centra aŭtoritato respondeca pri superrigardo, regado, kaj strategia disvolviĝo de publikaj rimedoj. La Agentejo funkcias sendepende, sed sub la kontrolo de la Ministerio pri Ekonomia Regulado, kaj estas taskita administri publikajn entreprenojn, ŝtatajn akciojn en kompanioj, strategian infrastrukturon, kaj terhavaĵojn posedatajn de la ŝtato. AASP estas rajtigita kontroli la agadon de tiuj posedoj, proponi privatigojn aŭ investojn, kaj certigi efikan kaj travideblan administradon. Ĝi konservas publikan registron de ŝtataj posedoj kaj regule publikigas raportojn por certigi respondecon. La agentejo ankaŭ havas la aŭtoritaton interveni en miskompreno de posedaĵoj kaj kunlabori kun aliaj ministerioj por certigi intersektoran kunordigon. Ĝi estas jure devigita funkcii por la publika bono kaj protektita kontraŭ koruptado.

name: Sectors under Public Ownership
content: This section defines the core sectors which are considered natural monopolies or essential public services and thus fall under state ownership and control. These include electricity generation and transmission, water distribution, public transportation infrastructure (rail and air traffic control), postal services, and the maintenance of navigable waterways. These sectors are either impractical to liberalize due to scale or safety concerns or serve a universal function best managed by the state. The law restricts privatization in these sectors unless it is demonstrably in the public interest and subject to strong regulatory safeguards. Ministries such as Environmental Stewardship and Infrastructure Development are to collaborate with the Agency to ensure technical and policy alignment. The section also mandates transparent pricing models and service standards to guarantee affordable access for all citizens.
translation: Ĉi tiu sekcio difinas la kernajn sektorojn konsideratajn naturaj monopoloj aŭ esencaj publikaj servoj kaj tial sub ŝtata posedado kaj kontrolo. Ili inkluzivas elektran generadon kaj transdonon, akvodistribuon, publikan transportinfrastrukturon (fervojo kaj aerkontrolado), poŝtajn servojn, kaj la prizorgadon de navigeblaj akvovojoj. Tiuj sektoroj estas aŭ nepraktike liberaligeblaj pro amplekso aŭ sekureco, aŭ plenumas universalan funkcion plej bone administratan de la ŝtato. La leĝo limigas privatigon en tiuj sektoroj krom se ĝi estas klare en la publika intereso kaj submetita al fortaj reguligaj garantioj. Ministerioj kiel Media Protektado kaj Infrastruktura Evoluigo devas kunlabori kun la Agentejo por certigi teknikan kaj politikan akordon. La sekcio ankaŭ postulas travideblajn prezo-modelojn kaj servajn normojn por garantii alireblecon por ĉiuj civitanoj.

name: Public Asset Performance and Evaluation
content: The performance of public assets must be routinely evaluated using metrics that assess financial sustainability, efficiency, public benefit, and long-term strategic value. This section defines the framework for periodic audits, benchmarking, and reporting, mandating the Agency for the Administration of State Assets to create a centralized dashboard for tracking asset performance. Ministries are obligated to contribute to data-sharing for all sectoral assets under their purview. In cases of persistent underperformance, the Agency may recommend restructuring, public-private partnerships, or justified divestment. Any such measures require a transparent public consultation process. This evaluation framework is designed to ensure that state ownership contributes positively to national welfare, and that the public receives clear evidence of the value derived from such ownership.
translation: La agado de publikaj posedoj devas esti rutine taksata per metrikoj kiuj taksas financan daŭripovon, efikecon, publikan profiton, kaj longtempan strategian valoron. Ĉi tiu sekcio difinas la kadron por periodaj aŭdoj, komparoj, kaj raportado, devigante la Agentejon por la Administrado de Ŝtataj Posedaĵoj krei centralizitan panelon por spuri posedaĵ-agadon. Ministerioj estas devigitaj kontribui al datum-dividado por ĉiuj sektoraj posedoj sub ilia aŭtoritato. En kazoj de konstanta subagado, la Agentejo povas proponi restrukturadon, publik-privatajn partnerecojn, aŭ pravigitan vendadon. Ĉiuj tiaj mezuroj postulas travideblan publikan konsultan procezon. Ĉi tiu taks-kadro celas certigi ke ŝtata posedado kontribuas pozitive al nacia bonfarto, kaj ke la publiko ricevas klarajn pruvojn de la valoro devenanta de tia posedado.

name: Transparency, Anti-Corruption, and Accountability
content: This section mandates strict transparency and anti-corruption safeguards in the management of state assets. All transactions, acquisitions, and divestments must be documented, made publicly available, and subjected to independent audits. The Agency for the Administration of State Assets is required to collaborate with the Ministry of Justice and Rule of Law to investigate any cases of fraud, mismanagement, or illicit enrichment. Whistleblower protections are enshrined, and citizen reporting mechanisms are to be integrated into the Agency’s operations. Performance bonuses for public asset managers must be linked to long-term value generation and ethical conduct. Any violation of the standards set forth in this section may result in administrative sanctions or criminal prosecution. The section ensures that state ownership is not only effective but also fair, just, and trusted by the people.
translation: Ĉi tiu sekcio postulas striktajn travideblecajn kaj kontraŭkoruptajn garantiojn en la administrado de ŝtataj posedoj. Ĉiuj transakcioj, aĉetoj, kaj vendoj devas esti dokumentitaj, publike disponeblaj, kaj submetitaj al sendependaj aŭdoj. La Agentejo por la Administrado de Ŝtataj Posedaĵoj estas devigita kunlabori kun la Ministerio pri Justeco kaj Leĝa Regado por esplori ajnajn kazojn de fraŭdo, miskompreno, aŭ kontraŭleĝa riĉiĝo. Protektoj por informantoj estas garantiitaj, kaj mekanismoj por civitana raportado estas integritaj en la operaciojn de la Agentejo. Agad-premioj por ŝtataj posed-administrantoj devas esti ligitaj al longtempa valorkreado kaj etika konduto. Ajna malobservo de la normoj difinitaj en ĉi tiu sekcio povas konduki al administraj sankcioj aŭ krimaj persekutoj. La sekcio certigas ke ŝtata posedado estu ne nur efika sed ankaŭ justa, justa, kaj fidinda de la publiko.

name: Deliberative Democracy
content: The state shall promote a system of governance grounded in collective reasoning, open debate, and citizen engagement. Deliberative democracy emphasizes thoughtful discussion, the inclusion of diverse perspectives, and the search for common ground through informed and respectful discourse. It prioritizes reasoned decision-making and institutional frameworks that support civic participation and consensus-building processes.
translation: L'État s'engage à promouvoir un système de gouvernance fondé sur la délibération collective, le débat ouvert et la participation citoyenne. La démocratie délibérative met l'accent sur la diversité des points de vue, la recherche d'un terrain d'entente, et la prise de décisions éclairées dans un esprit de respect mutuel. Elle privilégie une gouvernance participative et des institutions favorisant l'engagement civique et la construction du consensus.

name: Consensus-Based Governance
content: The state shall endeavor to base political and administrative decisions on broad consensus, seeking agreement among major stakeholders rather than imposing outcomes by simple majority. This approach enhances social cohesion, mutual respect, and long-term policy stability. It supports mechanisms that allow minority voices to be heard and integrated into decision-making.
translation: L'État s'efforce de fonder ses décisions politiques et administratives sur un large consensus, en recherchant l'accord des principales parties prenantes plutôt que l'imposition de solutions à la majorité simple. Cette approche renforce la cohésion sociale, le respect mutuel et la stabilité des politiques publiques à long terme. Elle garantit l'écoute et l'intégration des voix minoritaires dans le processus décisionnel.

name: Intergenerational Justice
content: The state shall ensure that decisions made today respect the rights and opportunities of future generations. Public policy must be sustainable, equitable, and responsible, preserving environmental, economic, and cultural resources for those not yet born. Intergenerational justice requires long-term thinking and mechanisms for accountability over time.
translation: L'État veille à ce que les décisions actuelles respectent les droits et les opportunités des générations futures. Les politiques publiques doivent être durables, équitables et responsables, garantissant la préservation des ressources environnementales, économiques et culturelles. La justice intergénérationnelle impose une réflexion à long terme et des mécanismes de reddition de comptes dans la durée.

name: Social Solidarity
content: The state shall cultivate a spirit of mutual aid, inclusion, and shared responsibility among all members of society. Through public institutions and legal guarantees, it ensures support for vulnerable individuals and promotes mechanisms of redistribution, protection, and social cohesion.
translation: L'État cultive un esprit de solidarité, d'entraide et de responsabilité partagée au sein de la société. Par ses institutions publiques et garanties juridiques, il soutient les personnes vulnérables et promeut des mécanismes de redistribution, de protection et de cohésion sociale.

name: Transparency and Accountability
content: The state is committed to ensuring openness in its decision-making processes and to holding public authorities accountable for their actions. Citizens must have access to information and mechanisms to scrutinize, question, and challenge decisions. Transparency enhances trust, deters corruption, and promotes better governance.
translation: L'État s'engage à garantir la transparence de ses processus décisionnels et la responsabilité des autorités publiques. Les citoyens doivent avoir accès à l'information et à des mécanismes de contrôle, de questionnement et de contestation. La transparence renforce la confiance, prévient la corruption et améliore la gouvernance.

name: Guaranteeing Intergenerational Equity
content: The state is charged with ensuring that its actions today do not compromise the rights, resources, and well-being of future generations. This includes sustainable economic planning, environmental conservation, and prudent legal frameworks that weigh long-term consequences.
translation: L'État a la charge de garantir que ses actions présentes ne compromettent pas les droits, les ressources et le bien-être des générations futures. Cela implique une planification économique durable, la conservation de l'environnement et des cadres juridiques prudents tenant compte des conséquences à long terme.

name: Maintaining Cultural Continuity
content: The state recognizes its role in preserving and passing on cultural heritage, traditions, and national identity while remaining inclusive and adaptive to cultural evolution and diversity.
translation: L'État reconnaît son rôle dans la préservation et la transmission du patrimoine culturel, des traditions et de l'identité nationale tout en restant inclusif et adaptable à l'évolution et à la diversité culturelles.

name: Ensuring Scientific Advancement
content: The state fosters research, development, and technological innovation to support societal progress, address pressing challenges, and empower future knowledge economies.
translation: L'État favorise la recherche, le développement et l'innovation technologique pour soutenir le progrès sociétal, relever les défis urgents et renforcer les économies fondées sur le savoir du futur.

name: Upholding Constitutional Supremacy
content: The state affirms the primacy of its Constitution as the ultimate legal and moral foundation. All governance must be subordinate to and respectful of its principles.
translation: L'État affirme la primauté de sa Constitution en tant que fondement juridique et moral suprême. Toute gouvernance doit lui être subordonnée et respecter ses principes.

name: Protecting National Sovereignty
content: The state defends its independence, territorial integrity, and freedom from external domination, ensuring its people may determine their future free of coercion or undue influence.
translation: L'État défend son indépendance, son intégrité territoriale et sa liberté face à toute domination extérieure, afin de permettre à son peuple de décider de son avenir sans contrainte ni influence indue.

name: Fostering Deliberative Democracy
content: The state shall cultivate a deliberative democratic culture, one where public decisions arise from thoughtful, informed discussion among citizens and representatives. Unlike mere majority rule, this purpose emphasizes dialogue, transparency, and mutual understanding. Citizens must be afforded the time, resources, and education to meaningfully contribute to debate. The institutions of the state should be designed to encourage collaboration and constructive disagreement. Deliberative democracy ensures that the legitimacy of state power rests not just on numbers, but on reasoned consensus.
translation: L'État cultive une culture de démocratie délibérative, où les décisions publiques émanent de discussions réfléchies et informées entre citoyens et représentants. Contrairement à la simple règle de la majorité, cette finalité met l'accent sur le dialogue, la transparence et la compréhension mutuelle. Les citoyens doivent disposer du temps, des ressources et de l'éducation nécessaires pour participer de manière significative au débat. Les institutions de l'État doivent favoriser la collaboration et le désaccord constructif. La démocratie délibérative garantit que la légitimité du pouvoir étatique repose non seulement sur le nombre, mais sur le consensus raisonné.

name: Promoting Social Solidarity
content: The state is responsible for nurturing bonds of solidarity among its people. This includes reducing social inequalities, combating poverty, and ensuring access to healthcare, housing, and education for all. The state must guarantee a social safety net that protects individuals from systemic and personal hardship. Social solidarity is the recognition that each citizen’s well-being is connected to that of the community. In fulfilling this purpose, the state must not only redistribute wealth but also promote civic virtue, mutual aid, and a culture of compassion across its institutions and public discourse.
translation: L'État est chargé de nourrir les liens de solidarité entre ses citoyens. Cela inclut la réduction des inégalités sociales, la lutte contre la pauvreté et l'accès universel aux soins, au logement et à l'éducation. L'État doit garantir un filet de sécurité sociale protégeant les individus contre les difficultés systémiques ou personnelles. La solidarité sociale est la reconnaissance que le bien-être de chacun est lié à celui de la collectivité. Pour remplir cette mission, l'État ne doit pas seulement redistribuer les richesses, mais aussi promouvoir la vertu civique, l'entraide et une culture de compassion dans ses institutions et son discours public.

name: Uplifting Marginalized Communities
content: The state bears the duty of uplifting communities that have been historically marginalized or disadvantaged. This includes but is not limited to ethnic minorities, linguistic groups, religious communities, persons with disabilities, and individuals facing systemic discrimination. It must enact proactive measures to ensure full inclusion, legal protection, and equitable opportunity. This purpose does not merely guarantee equal treatment, but actively seeks to repair historical injustices and rebalance structural inequalities, allowing every citizen to thrive and fully participate in public life, free from prejudice and exclusion.
translation: L'État a pour devoir d'élever les communautés historiquement marginalisées ou défavorisées. Cela comprend, sans s'y limiter, les minorités ethniques, les groupes linguistiques, les communautés religieuses, les personnes en situation de handicap et les individus confrontés à des discriminations systémiques. Il doit mettre en œuvre des mesures proactives pour assurer une inclusion totale, une protection juridique et une égalité réelle des chances. Cette finalité ne garantit pas seulement l'égalité de traitement, mais cherche activement à réparer les injustices historiques et à rééquilibrer les inégalités structurelles, afin que chaque citoyen puisse s’épanouir et participer pleinement à la vie publique, à l’abri des préjugés et de l’exclusion.

name: Safeguarding the Natural Environment
content: The state shall act as a guardian of the natural environment, recognizing that ecological sustainability is essential to the survival and well-being of current and future generations. It must conserve biodiversity, fight climate change, and prevent environmental degradation. Natural resources must be managed prudently, not as commodities for exploitation, but as common goods. Environmental protection is not a secondary concern, but a foundational responsibility that should inform all other state activities and policies, particularly economic development and infrastructure.
translation: L'État doit agir comme gardien de l'environnement naturel, reconnaissant que la durabilité écologique est essentielle à la survie et au bien-être des générations présentes et futures. Il doit préserver la biodiversité, lutter contre le changement climatique et prévenir la dégradation de l'environnement. Les ressources naturelles doivent être gérées avec prudence, non comme des marchandises à exploiter, mais comme des biens communs. La protection de l’environnement n’est pas une préoccupation secondaire, mais une responsabilité fondamentale qui doit orienter toutes les autres politiques et activités de l’État, notamment en matière de développement économique et d’infrastructures.

name: Institutionalizing Participatory Governance
content: The state must institutionalize mechanisms that enable citizens to directly engage in governance beyond elections. This includes participatory budgeting, civic councils, citizen assemblies, referenda, and public oversight bodies. Participation must be inclusive, accessible, and meaningful—especially for those traditionally excluded. Such structures deepen democracy by embedding it within daily political life, allowing citizens to shape decisions that affect them directly. This purpose empowers individuals as co-creators of policy and strengthens the legitimacy and responsiveness of the government.
translation: L'État doit institutionnaliser des mécanismes permettant aux citoyens de participer directement à la gouvernance, au-delà des élections. Cela comprend le budget participatif, les conseils civiques, les assemblées citoyennes, les référendums et les organes de contrôle public. La participation doit être inclusive, accessible et véritablement significative—en particulier pour les populations traditionnellement exclues. De telles structures approfondissent la démocratie en l’ancrant dans la vie politique quotidienne, permettant aux citoyens de façonner les décisions qui les concernent. Cette finalité renforce l’autonomie des individus en tant que co-auteurs des politiques et accroît la légitimité et la réactivité du gouvernement.

name: Registration at Birth
content: All individuals born within the state territory shall be registered within thirty days of birth at a civil registry office.
translation: Tout individu né sur le territoire de l'État doit être enregistré dans un bureau d'état civil dans un délai de trente jours suivant la naissance.

name: National Identity Number
content: Each citizen shall be issued a unique national identity number upon registration of birth or naturalization.
translation: Chaque citoyen se voit attribuer un numéro d'identité national unique lors de l'enregistrement de naissance ou de la naturalisation.

name: Right to Civil Documents
content: All registered individuals have the right to obtain official civil documents including birth certificates, identity cards, and proof of address.
translation: Toute personne enregistrée a le droit d'obtenir des documents civils officiels tels que les certificats de naissance, les cartes d'identité et les justificatifs de domicile.

name: Amendment of Civil Records
content: Civil records may be amended upon verified evidence or judicial order in accordance with state procedures.
translation: Les registres civils peuvent être modifiés sur la base de preuves vérifiées ou d'une décision judiciaire conformément aux procédures de l'État.

name: Naturalization and Equal Citizenship
content:
The following provisions govern the acquisition of citizenship through naturalization, and guarantee full civil, political, and social rights to all persons lawfully naturalized—
  1. Eligibility: Any person who has resided lawfully within the territory for a minimum of five consecutive years, demonstrates proficiency in a national language, passes a standardized civic and constitutional knowledge assessment, and fulfills lawful income and integration conditions may petition for naturalization.
  2. Equal Status: Naturalized citizens shall, from the date of issuance of the certificate of citizenship, enjoy all rights and obligations under law without distinction from citizens by birth, including eligibility for public office, access to public services, and protection abroad.
  3. Due Process: Rejection of an application must be reasoned in writing and is subject to appeal before the National Administrative Court. No application may be denied on grounds of race, religion, gender identity, or political belief.
  4. Streamlined Process: Procedures shall be timely, non-discriminatory, and standardized nationwide. All forms and requirements shall be made publicly accessible and available in multiple languages. Fees shall be proportionate and waivable for low-income applicants.
translation: Les dispositions suivantes régissent l'acquisition de la citoyenneté par naturalisation et garantissent à toute personne légalement naturalisée l’égalité complète des droits civils, politiques et sociaux—

name: Digital Identity System
content:
The following establishes a secure, unified, and sovereign digital identity system issued and managed by the state—
  1. Issuance: Every resident shall be entitled to a state-issued digital identity containing biometric verification, cryptographic safeguards, and a unique digital certificate. Issuance shall be based on verified physical documents and securely stored metadata.
  2. Use: The digital identity shall serve as a means for authentication and access to public services, e-voting, contract execution, and official transactions. It shall be recognized as legally equivalent to physical identity credentials.
  3. Control and Consent: Individuals retain full legal ownership of their identity profile. Consent shall be required for any third-party access, with mechanisms for time-limited and purpose-bound data use.
  4. Safeguards: All data shall be stored in encrypted, sovereign-controlled servers. Breaches or unauthorized access shall be criminally punishable and subject to independent audit.
  5. Interoperability and Accessibility: The system shall be accessible to individuals with disabilities and shall allow integration with international digital standards, provided such integration does not compromise national sovereignty or user privacy.
translation: Les dispositions suivantes établissent un système d'identité numérique unifié, sécurisé et souverain émis et géré par l'État—

name: Procedure for Identity Change
content:
The following provides the legal process for changing one's civil identity in public registries—
  1. Scope: Any person shall have the right to change their legal name, gender marker, and other personal identifiers recorded in civil status registries, upon written declaration and supporting documentation affirming the request.
  2. Confidentiality: All proceedings shall be conducted with strict confidentiality. Disclosure of past identifiers without consent shall be prohibited and sanctionable under privacy protection laws.
  3. Accessibility: Applications shall be received by local civil registry offices, with decisions rendered within 60 days. No medical or psychological certification shall be required unless the change affects medical treatment access.
  4. Appeals and Protection: In the case of denial, applicants may file for expedited judicial review. Discrimination, harassment, or refusal of services on the basis of previous identity shall be actionable under anti-discrimination law.
  5. Recognition: Identity changes duly registered shall be recognized by all public and private institutions and be reflected in all subsequent legal, educational, financial, and medical documents.
translation: Les dispositions suivantes définissent le processus légal pour changer son identité civile dans les registres publics—

name: Public Data Portal and Transparency Framework
content:
The following establishes a centralized, live-access system for publication and review of non-classified public data—
  1. Access: All persons shall have equal access to the Public Data Portal, which shall provide demographic, statistical, administrative, and service delivery data in machine-readable and human-accessible formats, with historical data archives.
  2. Publication Mandate: All government departments are required to submit non-confidential data on a rolling basis. Submission deadlines, data quality requirements, and verification processes shall be standardized under ministerial regulation.
  3. Audit and Integrity: The data portal shall undergo quarterly integrity audits by an Independent Data Oversight Commission, whose reports shall be made public and debated in Parliament annually.
  4. Accessibility: Data formats must comply with web accessibility standards, and search interfaces must be multilingual, filterable, and navigable on low-bandwidth connections.
  5. Limitations: Personally identifiable information must be fully anonymized. Any breaches of confidentiality shall be subject to civil and criminal penalties.
translation: Les dispositions suivantes instaurent un système centralisé et accessible en direct pour la publication et la consultation des données publiques non classifiées—

name: Personal Data Ownership and Access Rights
content:
The following affirms the individual’s full ownership over their personal data and establishes enforceable rights and duties concerning state-managed data—
  1. Ownership: Each individual shall retain legal ownership of all personal data held by any public authority, including biometric, health, identity, financial, and digital activity records.
  2. Access and Correction: Individuals have the right to access any personal data retained by public institutions within 30 days of request and to request corrections or updates at no cost.
  3. Portability and Erasure: Individuals may export their personal data in a structured, interoperable format, and may request deletion unless retention is required by law for a specific purpose.
  4. Consent and Use: Public entities must obtain prior informed consent for any processing of personal data beyond what is strictly necessary for core public functions.
  5. Enforcement and Remedies: Violations of data rights shall be reviewable by the Data Rights Ombudsman, with recourse to court and entitlement to compensation for material and non-material damage.
translation: Les dispositions suivantes affirment la pleine propriété des individus sur leurs données personnelles et établissent des droits et obligations exécutoires concernant les données gérées par l'État—

name: Jurisdictions of Criminal Prosecution
content: The jurisdiction over criminal prosecution shall be divided among designated public security forces based on the nature, scale, and location of the crime. Urban crimes involving organized syndicates, cybercrimes, and transnational offenses shall fall under the jurisdiction of the National Investigative Bureau. Local public security departments shall retain primary jurisdiction over routine infractions, property offenses, and crimes confined to municipal boundaries. Cases implicating public officials or threatening national security shall be escalated to the High Office of Investigative Integrity. Coordination mechanisms must exist to facilitate shared intelligence and ensure seamless handoff of responsibility, avoiding overlap or gaps in enforcement.
translation: La juridiction en matière de poursuite pénale est répartie entre les forces de sécurité publique désignées, selon la nature, l'ampleur et le lieu de l'infraction. Les crimes urbains impliquant des syndicats organisés, les cyberdélits et les infractions transnationales relèvent de la compétence du Bureau National d’Enquête. Les départements de sécurité publique locaux conservent la compétence principale sur les infractions courantes, les délits contre les biens et les crimes circonscrits à l'échelle municipale. Les affaires impliquant des agents publics ou menaçant la sécurité nationale doivent être transmises au Haut Bureau de l’Intégrité Enquêteuse. Des mécanismes de coordination doivent permettre un échange d’informations fluide et une répartition efficace des responsabilités.

name: Crimes against Persons
content:
The following constitute crimes against persons and are punishable under criminal law due to their direct or indirect threat to the life, liberty, or physical and psychological integrity of individuals:

  1. Intentional Homicide: The deliberate and unlawful killing of another human being, committed with the conscious intent to cause death or with knowledge that death would likely result from one's actions.
  2. Negligent Homicide: The unintentional causing of death due to gross negligence, recklessness, or a failure to observe reasonable care where such failure results in the loss of human life.
  3. Attempted Murder: The act of intentionally engaging in conduct intended to result in the unlawful killing of another person, accompanied by a substantial step toward the commission of that killing.
  4. Aggravated Assault: The intentional infliction of serious bodily harm or the attempt thereof, often involving the use of a deadly weapon or occurring under circumstances demonstrating extreme disregard for human life.
  5. Simple Assault: The unlawful and intentional act of causing or attempting to cause bodily harm to another person, or intentionally placing another in fear of imminent physical harm.
  6. Battery: The unlawful and intentional physical contact with another person without their consent, where such contact is offensive or harmful in nature.
  7. Kidnapping: The unlawful and intentional abduction or transportation of a person by means of force, threat, deception, or coercion, with the intent to restrain the person's liberty.
  8. Unlawful Confinement: Knowingly and without legal authority restraining the movement of another person in a bounded area against their will, by force or threat.
  9. Human Trafficking: The recruitment, transportation, harboring, or receipt of persons through the use of force, fraud, or coercion for the purpose of exploitation, including forced labor or sexual servitude.
  10. Torture: The intentional infliction of severe physical or mental pain or suffering on a person for purposes such as obtaining information, punishment, intimidation, or coercion, particularly when perpetrated by or with the acquiescence of a public official.
  11. Threat of Violence: Any communication or conduct that intentionally places another person in reasonable fear of imminent bodily harm or death, regardless of whether the threat is carried out.
  12. Forced Sterilization: Performing or causing to be performed a sterilization procedure on a person without their full, free, and informed consent, typically for discriminatory or coercive reasons.
  13. Harassment: A pattern of deliberate and unwanted conduct—verbal, physical, or electronic—directed at a specific person that causes fear, anxiety, or emotional distress.
  14. Domestic Abuse: Any physical, sexual, psychological, or economic abuse perpetrated within an intimate or familial relationship, used to control or dominate the victim.
  15. Stalking: The repeated and intentional following, monitoring, or harassment of a person, creating a reasonable fear for their safety or the safety of others.
translation: Les infractions suivantes constituent des crimes contre les personnes et sont punissables en droit pénal en raison de leur menace directe ou indirecte à la vie, à la liberté, ou à l'intégrité physique et psychologique des individus : 1. Homicide intentionnel : Le meurtre délibéré et illégal d’un autre être humain, commis avec l’intention de tuer ou la conscience que la mort est probable. 2. Homicide par négligence : Le décès non intentionnel résultant d’une négligence grave ou d’un manquement au devoir de diligence. 3. Tentative de meurtre : L’acte d’intenter délibérément à la vie d’autrui avec un début d’exécution substantiel. 4. Agression aggravée : L’infliction intentionnelle de dommages corporels graves, souvent avec une arme ou dans des circonstances démontrant un mépris extrême pour la vie. 5. Agression simple : L’acte illégal et intentionnel de causer ou de menacer un préjudice corporel immédiat. 6. Coups et blessures : Le contact physique intentionnel et non consenti, offensant ou nuisible. 7. Enlèvement : L’abduction ou le déplacement illégal et intentionnel d’une personne par la force, menace, ou tromperie. 8. Séquestration illégale : La restriction de mouvement sans autorité légale, par la force ou menace. 9. Traite des êtres humains : Le recrutement, transport ou hébergement de personnes à des fins d’exploitation par la force, fraude ou coercition. 10. Torture : L’infliction intentionnelle de douleurs physiques ou mentales graves à des fins d’interrogatoire, de punition ou d’intimidation. 11. Menace de violence : Toute communication ou conduite qui fait craindre raisonnablement un préjudice corporel imminent. 12. Stérilisation forcée : Réalisation d’une stérilisation sans consentement libre et éclairé. 13. Harcèlement : Comportement répété et non sollicité causant peur ou détresse. 14. Violence domestique : Tout abus physique, sexuel, psychologique ou économique au sein d’un couple ou d’une famille. 15. Traque : Surveillance ou harcèlement répété créant une peur raisonnable pour la sécurité.

name: Crimes against Liberty
content:
The following constitute crimes against liberty and are punishable as violations of individual autonomy, freedom of movement, personal security, and free will:

  1. Unlawful Detention: Knowingly restraining or detaining a person without legal authority or justification, thereby depriving them of their personal liberty.
  2. Coercion: The use of threats, intimidation, or psychological pressure to compel a person to act against their will or to forgo a legal right.
  3. Abduction: The intentional and unlawful taking or transportation of a person, without consent, through force or deception, with the aim of depriving them of liberty or placing them under control.
  4. Slavery: The exercise of ownership rights over another person, including buying, selling, or exploiting individuals as property.
  5. Forced Labor: Compelling a person to work or provide services through threats, violence, or abuse of power, without the person's free and informed consent.
  6. Servitude: The condition in which a person is forced to live or work under coercive control, with restricted freedom to leave or refuse obligations.
  7. Obstruction of Freedom of Assembly: Willfully preventing or disrupting lawful gatherings, protests, or meetings through violence, threats, or unlawful interference.
  8. Obstruction of Freedom of Movement: Intentionally restricting a person's lawful ability to move within, enter, or exit any public or private space without due legal cause.
  9. Interference with Privacy: The intentional and unauthorized surveillance, intrusion, or collection of personal data that violates a person’s reasonable expectation of privacy.
  10. Suppression of Expression: Using violence, threats, or official capacity to prevent individuals from lawfully expressing opinions, sharing information, or communicating ideas.
translation: Les infractions suivantes constituent des crimes contre la liberté et sont punissables comme violations de l'autonomie individuelle, de la liberté de mouvement, de la sécurité personnelle et du libre arbitre : 1. Détention illégale : Le fait de retenir une personne sans autorité ou justification légale, la privant ainsi de sa liberté. 2. Contrainte : L’usage de menaces ou de pressions psychologiques pour forcer une personne à agir contre sa volonté. 3. Enlèvement : Le fait de prendre ou transporter illégalement une personne par la force ou la tromperie. 4. Esclavage : L’exercice de droits de propriété sur une personne, y compris la vente ou l’exploitation comme un bien. 5. Travail forcé : Obliger une personne à travailler sans consentement libre, sous menace ou contrainte. 6. Servitude : Condition où une personne est forcée de vivre ou de travailler sous contrôle coercitif. 7. Entrave à la liberté de réunion : Empêcher délibérément des rassemblements légaux. 8. Entrave à la liberté de mouvement : Limitation illégale du droit de se déplacer. 9. Atteinte à la vie privée : Surveillance ou collecte de données sans autorisation. 10. Répression de l’expression : Empêcher une personne de s’exprimer librement par menace ou violence.

name: Crimes against the State
content:
The following constitute crimes against the state and are punishable as threats to the sovereignty, institutional integrity, and constitutional order of the Republic:

  1. Treason: Knowingly and intentionally engaging in acts aimed at overthrowing, subverting, or waging war against the Republic, or aiding a foreign power against the interest of the state.
  2. Espionage: The unauthorized collection, transmission, or sharing of sensitive state information with foreign entities or for purposes of undermining national security.
  3. Sedition: Organizing or inciting rebellion, violence, or public disorder with the intent to challenge the authority or legitimacy of the government through unlawful means.
  4. Sabotage: The intentional destruction, obstruction, or degradation of state infrastructure, services, or resources for political, military, or ideological motives.
  5. Unauthorized Armed Activity: Organizing, leading, or participating in military or paramilitary operations not sanctioned by the competent state authorities.
  6. Contempt of State Institutions: Publicly discrediting, defaming, or obstructing the operation of constitutional bodies or officials with intent to undermine their legitimacy or public function.
  7. Impersonation of Officials: Falsely representing oneself as a public official for the purpose of exercising public powers or accessing protected rights or information.
  8. Illegal Use of State Symbols: Unauthorized and deceptive use of state emblems, flags, seals, or insignia to convey false authority or mislead the public.
  9. Obstruction of Public Functions: Willfully interfering with or preventing the lawful duties of government agencies or officials through threats, coercion, or physical force.
  10. Election Tampering: Engaging in fraudulent activities intended to alter, suppress, or manipulate the conduct or results of public elections, referenda, or plebiscites.
translation: Les infractions suivantes constituent des crimes contre l'État et sont punissables comme atteintes à la souveraineté, à l'intégrité institutionnelle et à l'ordre constitutionnel de la République : 1. Trahison : Actes délibérés visant à renverser ou affaiblir la République ou aider une puissance étrangère. 2. Espionnage : Collecte ou transmission non autorisée d’informations sensibles à des entités étrangères. 3. Sédition : Incitation à la rébellion ou à la violence contre l’autorité de l’État. 4. Sabotage : Destruction intentionnelle des infrastructures ou ressources étatiques. 5. Activité armée non autorisée : Participation à des opérations militaires sans mandat légal. 6. Outrage aux institutions : Décrédibilisation ou obstruction délibérée des organes constitutionnels. 7. Usurpation de fonction : Se faire passer pour un agent public afin d’exercer illégalement un pouvoir. 8. Usage illégal des symboles d’État : Utilisation trompeuse des emblèmes officiels pour induire en erreur. 9. Obstruction des fonctions publiques : Interférence volontaire avec l’exercice légal des fonctions étatiques. 10. Fraude électorale : Manipulation intentionnelle du déroulement ou des résultats d’une élection publique.

name: Crimes Against Bodily Integrity
content: The following constitute crimes against bodily integrity: (1) Mutilation, defined as the intentional infliction of serious bodily harm resulting in permanent disfigurement or loss of function. (2) Unlawful organ removal or trafficking, including harvesting organs without full and informed consent or through coercion. (3) Exposure to hazardous substances, where a person is intentionally subjected to toxic chemicals or biohazards causing significant health damage. (4) Non-consensual medical experimentation. (5) Forced medical procedures or treatment, including forced sterilization or surgeries. (6) Assault resulting in permanent injury or disability. (7) Compelled participation in activities with high risk of bodily harm without informed consent. (8) Deliberate infection with serious communicable diseases.
translation: Les infractions suivantes constituent des crimes contre l'intégrité corporelle : (1) Mutilation. (2) Prélèvement ou trafic d'organes sans consentement. (3) Exposition intentionnelle à des substances toxiques. (4) Expérimentation médicale non consentie. (5) Traitements médicaux forcés. (6) Blessures causant invalidité permanente. (7) Activités dangereuses imposées sans consentement. (8) Transmission intentionnelle de maladies graves.

name: Economic and Property Crimes
content: The following constitute economic and property crimes: (1) Theft, defined as the unlawful taking of property belonging to another with the intent to permanently deprive them of it. (2) Robbery, defined as theft accompanied by violence or threat. (3) Burglary, entering a structure unlawfully with intent to commit theft or other crimes. (4) Embezzlement, involving the misappropriation of funds entrusted to one’s care. (5) Fraud, including deliberate deception for unlawful gain. (6) Extortion, obtaining property through coercion or threat. (7) Money laundering, concealing origins of illegally obtained money. (8) Counterfeiting of currency or documents. (9) Insider trading and market manipulation. (10) Destruction or sabotage of property belonging to others or the public.
translation: Les infractions suivantes constituent des crimes économiques ou contre les biens : (1) Vol. (2) Vol avec violence (vol à main armée). (3) Cambriolage. (4) Détournement de fonds. (5) Fraude. (6) Extorsion. (7) Blanchiment d'argent. (8) Contrefaçon de monnaie ou de documents. (9) Délits d’initiés. (10) Dégradation de biens publics ou privés.

name: Cybercrimes
content: The following constitute cybercrimes: (1) Unauthorized access to computer systems (hacking), including bypassing security protocols without permission. (2) Cyber fraud, such as phishing, identity theft, or scams committed using electronic communication. (3) Distribution of malware, spyware, or ransomware. (4) Online harassment and cyberbullying. (5) Child pornography possession, production, or distribution. (6) Denial-of-service (DoS) or distributed DoS (DDoS) attacks. (7) Data breaches and theft of confidential information. (8) Unauthorized surveillance or data interception. (9) Cyberterrorism, including attacks designed to disrupt critical infrastructure. (10) Illicit trafficking via digital platforms, including weapons, drugs, or humans.
translation: Les infractions suivantes constituent des cybercrimes : (1) Accès non autorisé aux systèmes informatiques. (2) Fraude électronique. (3) Diffusion de logiciels malveillants. (4) Harcèlement en ligne. (5) Pornographie infantile en ligne. (6) Attaques DoS/DDoS. (7) Vol de données confidentielles. (8) Surveillance illégale. (9) Cyberterrorisme. (10) Trafic illégal sur des plateformes numériques.

name: Environmental and Public Health Offenses
content: The following constitute offenses against the environment and public health: (1) Illegal dumping, defined as the unauthorized disposal of waste materials in non-designated locations in a manner harmful to ecosystems or human health. (2) Pollution of air or water, where industrial, agricultural, or private entities release contaminants beyond lawful limits into the environment. (3) Wildlife trafficking, including the unlawful capture, sale, or transport of protected species or their parts. (4) Unauthorized deforestation, meaning tree clearing or forest degradation without permit or in violation of land-use laws. (5) Poaching, defined as the hunting, capturing, or killing of protected wildlife in contravention of conservation laws. (6) Endangering public health by actions that expose populations to communicable diseases or environmental toxins. (7) Distribution of unlicensed medicine or pharmaceuticals not approved by regulatory authorities. (8) Biohazard release, whether accidental or intentional, where pathogens or toxic materials are introduced into public spaces. (9) Violation of quarantine orders lawfully imposed during a health emergency. (10) Unsafe disposal of medical waste, including sharps or biological material, in violation of health safety standards.
translation: Les infractions suivantes constituent des atteintes à l'environnement et à la santé publique : dépôts illégaux, pollution, trafic d'espèces, déforestation illégale, braconnage, mise en danger de la santé publique, distribution de médicaments non autorisés, libération de biohazards, violation de quarantaine, et élimination dangereuse de déchets médicaux.

name: Social Order and Morality Offenses
content: The following constitute offenses against public order and morality: (1) Public indecency, defined as the willful exhibition of nudity or sexual conduct in public places likely to offend reasonable standards of decency. (2) Inciting violence, meaning speech or actions that directly provoke or encourage imminent acts of violence. (3) Hate speech, defined as public expressions that incite hatred or discrimination against persons based on race, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or other protected characteristics. (4) Desecration of cultural heritage, including damage or defilement of monuments, graves, or symbols of cultural or historical significance. (5) Disruption of public peace, where conduct such as shouting, fighting, or noise creation causes fear or disturbance. (6) Vandalism, defined as intentional damage or defacement of property not one’s own. (7) Unauthorized graffiti, meaning applying paint, etching, or markings to property without legal permission. (8) Animal cruelty, including neglect, torture, or unlawful killing of animals. (9) Loitering with intent to engage in criminal activity or harassment. (10) Public intoxication where behavior threatens safety, health, or peaceful enjoyment of public space.
translation: Les infractions suivantes troublent l'ordre public et la moralité : indécence publique, incitation à la violence, discours haineux, profanation du patrimoine, trouble à la paix, vandalisme, graffiti non autorisé, cruauté envers les animaux, flânerie suspecte, et ivresse publique.

name: Administrative and Procedural Offenses
content: The following constitute administrative and procedural offenses: (1) Failure to respond to lawful summons, including non-appearance in administrative or judicial proceedings without valid excuse. (2) Obstruction of regulatory inspection, defined as preventing or impeding lawful entry by inspectors or auditors into premises subject to oversight. (3) Failure to maintain required records, including non-compliance with documentation obligations imposed by law or regulation. (4) Submission of false or misleading information in official filings or applications. (5) Unauthorized use of protected titles, credentials, or uniforms reserved by law for licensed professionals or officials. (6) Unauthorized access to restricted public administration systems or confidential government databases. (7) Disobedience of administrative orders or directives lawfully issued by regulatory authorities. (8) Improper lobbying or offering inducements to public officials. (9) Misuse of public funds by administrative personnel. (10) Unauthorized public gathering or demonstration without required permits or in violation of designated restrictions.
translation: Les infractions suivantes relèvent des manquements administratifs et procéduraux : non-respect des convocations, obstruction aux inspections, défaut de tenue de registres, informations fausses, usage non autorisé de titres protégés, accès interdit aux bases publiques, désobéissance administrative, lobbying illégal, abus de fonds publics, et rassemblements non autorisés.

name: Transportation and Traffic Offenses
content:
The following are crimes against public safety and welfare, prosecutable exclusively by the state authorities—
  1. Reckless driving: The operation of a motor vehicle with willful or wanton disregard for the safety of persons or property.
  2. Driving under the influence: The operation of a vehicle while impaired by alcohol, narcotics, or any controlled substance beyond legal thresholds.
  3. Vehicular manslaughter: The unlawful killing of a person resulting from negligent or unlawful operation of a motor vehicle.
  4. Hit and run: The act of causing a traffic collision and failing to stop to render aid or provide identifying information as required by law.
  5. Unlicensed operation of a vehicle: Driving without a valid permit, license, or in violation of restrictions.
  6. Tampering with road signs: Modifying, obscuring, relocating, or removing official traffic signage or signals without lawful authorization.
  7. Street racing: The unauthorized competitive operation of vehicles on public roads or highways.
  8. Obstruction of emergency vehicles: Unlawfully impeding or failing to yield to authorized emergency response vehicles.
  9. Endangerment of pedestrians: Failure to yield in designated crossings or operating in a manner that creates unreasonable risk to pedestrians.
  10. Illegal parking in emergency zones: Leaving a vehicle in spaces reserved for emergency use or impeding emergency access routes.
translation:
Les infractions suivantes relèvent de la sécurité publique et du bien-être, poursuivables exclusivement par les autorités étatiques—
  1. conduite dangereuse : L'opération d'un véhicule à moteur avec mépris volontaire ou insouciant de la sécurité des personnes ou des biens.
  2. conduite sous influence : Conduite d'un véhicule sous l'effet de l'alcool, des stupéfiants ou de toute substance contrôlée au-delà des seuils légaux.
  3. homicide routier : Le meurtre illégal d'une personne résultant d'une conduite négligente ou illégale d'un véhicule à moteur.
  4. délit de fuite : L'acte de causer une collision routière et de ne pas s'arrêter pour porter assistance ou fournir les informations d'identification requises par la loi.
  5. conduite sans permis : Conduire sans un permis valide, ou en violation des restrictions imposées.
  6. altération de la signalisation routière : Modifier, obscurcir, déplacer ou retirer la signalisation officielle sans autorisation légale.
  7. courses de rue : La conduite compétitive non autorisée de véhicules sur des routes ou autoroutes publiques.
  8. obstruction aux véhicules d'urgence : Empêcher illégalement ou ne pas céder le passage aux véhicules de secours autorisés.
  9. mise en danger des piétons : Ne pas céder le passage aux passages désignés ou conduire d'une manière qui crée un risque déraisonnable pour les piétons.
  10. stationnement illégal dans les zones d'urgence : Laisser un véhicule dans des espaces réservés à l'utilisation d'urgence ou entraver l'accès aux voies d'urgence.

name: Crimes of Infiltration or Sabotage
content:
The following are crimes against national security, prosecutable exclusively by the state authorities—
  1. Sabotage of infrastructure: The intentional destruction, damage, or disruption of public utilities, transport, communications, or energy facilities.
  2. Interference with communications: Unlawful obstruction, interception, or degradation of telecommunication networks, public communication infrastructure, or digital information systems.
  3. Breach of national registry: Unauthorized access, modification, or manipulation of official national databases, registers, or information repositories, including personal or governmental data.
  4. Tampering with surveillance systems: Deliberate and unlawful alteration or disabling of surveillance systems critical to national security, including cameras, tracking systems, and data gathering mechanisms.
  5. Unauthorized possession of security credentials: Possession or use of restricted access credentials or identification materials that are critical to security operations without proper authorization.
translation:
Les infractions suivantes relèvent de la sécurité nationale, poursuivables exclusivement par les autorités étatiques—
  1. sabotage d'infrastructure : La destruction, les dommages ou la perturbation intentionnelle des installations publiques, des transports, des communications ou des installations énergétiques.
  2. interférence avec les communications : L'obstruction illégale, l'interception ou la dégradation des réseaux de télécommunication, des infrastructures de communication publiques ou des systèmes d'information numériques.
  3. violation du registre national : Accès non autorisé, modification ou manipulation des bases de données nationales officielles, des registres ou des répertoires d'informations, y compris des données personnelles ou gouvernementales.
  4. altération des systèmes de surveillance : Modification délibérée et illégale ou désactivation des systèmes de surveillance essentiels à la sécurité nationale, y compris les caméras, les systèmes de suivi et les mécanismes de collecte de données.
  5. possession non autorisée de titres de sécurité : Possession ou utilisation de titres d'accès restreints ou de documents d'identification essentiels aux opérations de sécurité sans autorisation appropriée.

name: Crimes Against Democracy
content:
The following are crimes against democracy, prosecutable exclusively by the state authorities—
  1. Bribery: The offering, giving, receiving, or soliciting of any undue benefit, financial or otherwise, to influence the actions, decisions, or judgments of a public official, government employee, or other individuals in positions of power.
  2. Extortion: The unlawful act of obtaining money, property, or services through coercion, threats, or intimidation, particularly by a public official or entity in the performance of their duties.
  3. Abuse of Office: The improper use of authority or power by a public official or employee, wherein their actions or decisions benefit themselves, their associates, or any other party to the detriment of the public or state interests.
  4. Money Laundering: The process of concealing or disguising the origins of illegally obtained money, typically by means of transfers involving financial institutions, real estate, or other high-value transactions, to make the funds appear legitimate.
  5. Fraud: Any intentional act of deception for the purpose of securing an unfair or unlawful gain, particularly when involving government funds, public services, or state resources.
  6. Tax Evasion: The deliberate illegal underpayment or non-payment of taxes owed to the state by individuals or corporations, often through the concealment of income, assets, or other fraudulent financial practices.
  7. Conflict of Interest: A situation in which a public official or employee's personal interests or relationships interfere with their duty to act impartially, resulting in decisions that benefit themselves or others over the interests of the public or the state.
  8. Nepotism: The practice of favoring family members or close associates in the allocation of public jobs, resources, or benefits, without regard for merit, thereby undermining fairness and transparency in governmental operations.

name: Crimes Related to Terrorism
content:
The following are crimes related to terrorism, prosecutable exclusively by the state authorities—
  1. Terrorist Financing: The provision of funds or material support for the planning, preparation, or execution of terrorist acts, regardless of whether the funds are intended for weapons, recruitment, or other acts designed to destabilize or disrupt the peace of the nation.
  2. Supporting or Recruiting for a Terrorist Group: The act of offering material assistance, funds, or personnel to a group engaged in terrorist activities or attempting to recruit individuals to participate in such activities, whether domestically or internationally.
  3. Planning or Preparing a Terrorist Attack: Engaging in actions designed to carry out or prepare for acts of terrorism, including but not limited to gathering weapons, acquiring explosives, recruiting for militant causes, and organizing groups to perpetrate violence.
  4. Use of Explosive or Incendiary Devices: The illegal use, distribution, or possession of explosive or incendiary materials for the purpose of causing destruction, injury, or death as part of a terrorist act.
  5. Hijacking: The unlawful seizure or control of any vehicle, aircraft, or vessel, typically with the intention of using it for a terrorist purpose, such as the use of hostages or directing it towards a target of destruction.
  6. Hostage-Taking: The unlawful detention or control of individuals, typically to force the government or other parties to act in a way that aligns with the demands of the perpetrators of terrorism.

name: Crimes of Sovereignty and Territorial Integrity
content:
The following are crimes of sovereignty and territorial integrity, prosecutable exclusively by the state authorities—
  1. Espionage: The act of spying or obtaining unauthorized information related to the security, defense, or foreign affairs of the nation for the benefit of a foreign power, organization, or entity.
  2. Treason: The act of betraying one’s nation by assisting its enemies, engaging in war against the state, or attempting to overthrow the legitimate government.
  3. Conspiracy to Commit Treason: Any agreement or coordinated action intended to commit treason or to aid foreign powers in subverting or overthrowing the state or government.
  4. Invasion: The unlawful occupation or aggressive entry by foreign military forces or any non-state actors into the territory of the nation with the intent to seize, control, or disrupt national sovereignty.
  5. Territorial Disputes: Engaging in unlawful actions aimed at the seizure or annexation of territory belonging to another nation, including unauthorized settlements or military actions.

name: Immigration Crimes
content:
The following are immigration crimes, prosecutable exclusively by the state authorities—
  1. Illegal Entry: The act of entering the territory of the state without lawful authorization, bypassing the legal immigration controls or without the necessary visa, permit, or status required by the law.
  2. Document Fraud: The forging, altering, or misusing any official document for the purpose of evading immigration laws, obtaining illegal entry, or gaining unauthorized benefits.
  3. Overstay of Visa: The failure to leave the country after the expiration of a visa, permit, or other lawful entry authorization, including continued residence beyond the permitted time.
  4. Human Smuggling: The illegal facilitation of individuals entering or remaining in a country, typically through the use of fraudulent documents, improper routes, or manipulation of immigration laws.
  5. False Asylum Claims: The submission of fraudulent or misleading asylum claims for the purpose of gaining entry or staying in the country, while providing false or incomplete information to immigration authorities.
  6. Illegal Employment of Non-Citizens: The employment of individuals who are not authorized to work in the country or whose work visas or permits have expired, in violation of immigration and labor laws.

name: Organic Law on the Agency of Public Security
content:
The following constitutes the Organic Law governing the Agency of Public Security, defining its internal structure, command hierarchy, and mechanisms of public oversight, in accordance with the constitutional mandate of maintaining peace, justice, and democratic accountability—
  1. Composition of the Agency: The Agency of Public Security shall be composed of specialized and integrated units, each tasked with distinct public protection responsibilities. The following operational divisions shall be instituted within the Agency:
    1. General Order Division: responsible for the maintenance of civil peace, crowd management, and enforcement of regulations in public spaces.
    2. Minor Infractions and Civil Patrol Unit: tasked with responding to small-scale infractions, disturbances, and assisting in local law enforcement cooperation.
    3. Behavioral and Mental Health Crisis Unit: composed of professionals trained in de-escalation, crisis intervention, and collaboration with medical personnel in cases involving vulnerable persons.
    4. Community Liaison and Volunteer Unit: responsible for fostering citizen engagement, recruiting neighborhood watch groups, and organizing community safety forums.
    5. Public Protection Tactical Unit: an armed division trained to respond to high-risk threats, terrorism, and violent offenses within national territory.
    6. Crime Division – Homicide and Violent Crime Unit
    7. Crime Division – Sexual Offenses Unit
    8. Crime Division – Economic and Financial Crimes Unit
    9. Crime Division – Cybercrime Unit
    10. Crime Division – Environmental and Health Violations Unit
    11. Crime Division – Administrative and Public Integrity Unit
    12. Crime Division – National Security and Terrorism Unit
  2. Command Structure: The Agency shall be led by a Director-General appointed by the Minister of Justice and confirmed by a Parliamentary Oversight Committee. Each division shall be headed by a Chief Commander who reports directly to the Deputy Director of Operations.
  3. Oversight and Accountability: An Independent Commission for Security Oversight (ICSO) shall be established with full authority to review, investigate, and publish findings on agency conduct. All actions involving use of force, surveillance, or detention shall be logged, audited, and disclosed for independent review.
  4. Public Involvement: The Agency shall maintain regular dialogue with local governance bodies and civil society organizations. Public security strategy, budgeting, and policy shall include participatory consultation, and citizens may submit petitions, observations, and formal complaints regarding misconduct.

name: Independent Review of Public Security Action
content:
The following establishes the legally binding procedures and principles governing the independent, transparent, and impartial review of actions undertaken by public security forces, to ensure compliance with constitutional rights and legal proportionality, and shall be prosecutable and enforceable under the authority of the state—
  1. Judicial Oversight: All actions involving the deprivation of liberty, use of force, or intrusion upon fundamental rights by public security personnel shall be subject to judicial review within 72 hours of their occurrence, with mandatory reporting to the prosecutorial authority.
  2. Public Security Review Tribunal: An independent tribunal composed of judges, legal scholars, and civil liberties experts shall be established to hear cases of alleged misconduct, procedural abuse, or unjustified force.
  3. Citizen Committees: Local Citizen Review Boards shall be formed in each administrative region to receive complaints, audit response patterns, and publicly report findings on community impact and satisfaction with policing conduct.
  4. Proportionality and Necessity: Public security interventions must adhere to the principle of proportionality, ensuring that any use of force or coercive measure is strictly necessary, minimally sufficient, and exhausts nonviolent alternatives before application.
  5. Transparency Requirements: All public security units shall maintain complete audiovisual records of operational actions, to be archived and accessible for judicial and civilian review within strict data protection safeguards.
  6. Whistleblower Protections: Officers and employees reporting abuses, unlawful orders, or systemic misconduct shall receive full legal immunity and institutional protection from retaliation, in accordance with whistleblower integrity provisions.
  7. Annual Public Hearings: The Agency of Public Security shall be required to participate in annual hearings before Parliament and the Independent Commission for Security Oversight, where statistical data, complaints, resolutions, and disciplinary actions are disclosed.
  8. Legal Remedies and Compensation: Victims of abuse, unjustified detention, or excessive force shall have access to expedited judicial processes for seeking legal remedy, restitution, and public acknowledgment of wrongdoing.
  9. Training and Preventive Review: All security officers shall undergo recurrent legal training on use-of-force protocols, rights-based engagement, and de-escalation, with training programs subject to external audit.
  10. International Compliance: The independent review mechanisms shall operate in full conformity with international human rights law, and oversight reports shall be shared with relevant human rights bodies upon request.
translation:
Ce qui suit établit les procédures et principes juridiquement contraignants régissant l'examen indépendant, transparent et impartial des actions entreprises par les forces de sécurité publique, afin de garantir le respect des droits constitutionnels et de la proportionnalité légale, et doit être poursuivi et appliqué sous l'autorité exclusive de l'État—
  1. Surveillance judiciaire : Toute action impliquant la privation de liberté, l'usage de la force ou une atteinte aux droits fondamentaux par le personnel de sécurité publique doit faire l'objet d'un contrôle judiciaire dans les 72 heures suivant les faits, avec un rapport obligatoire au ministère public.
  2. Tribunal de révision de la sécurité publique : Un tribunal indépendant composé de juges, de juristes et d’experts en libertés civiles est institué pour statuer sur les cas de mauvaise conduite, d'abus procédural ou de recours injustifié à la force.
  3. Comités citoyens : Des conseils d'examen citoyen locaux sont établis dans chaque région administrative pour recevoir les plaintes, auditer les réponses sécuritaires, et publier des rapports sur l’impact communautaire et la satisfaction relative à la conduite policière.
  4. Proportionnalité et nécessité : Les interventions des forces de sécurité doivent respecter le principe de proportionnalité, assurant que tout usage de force ou mesure coercitive est strictement nécessaire, minimalement suffisant, et précédé de toutes les alternatives non violentes possibles.
  5. Exigences de transparence : Toutes les unités de sécurité publique doivent conserver des enregistrements audiovisuels complets de leurs actions opérationnelles, à archiver et rendre accessibles pour contrôle judiciaire et civil dans un cadre strict de protection des données.
  6. Protection des lanceurs d’alerte : Les agents signalant des abus, ordres illégaux ou dysfonctionnements systémiques bénéficient d’une immunité légale totale et d’une protection institutionnelle contre toute représaille.
  7. Audiences publiques annuelles : L’Agence de sécurité publique doit participer à des auditions annuelles devant le Parlement et la Commission indépendante de contrôle de la sécurité, pour y divulguer données statistiques, plaintes, résolutions et sanctions disciplinaires.
  8. Recours et compensation : Les victimes d’abus, de détentions injustifiées ou de force excessive ont accès à une procédure judiciaire accélérée pour demander réparation, indemnisation et reconnaissance publique des fautes subies.
  9. Formation et contrôle préventif : Tous les agents de sécurité doivent suivre une formation juridique continue sur les protocoles d’usage de la force, l’engagement fondé sur les droits, et la désescalade, avec des audits externes des programmes de formation.
  10. Conformité internationale : Les mécanismes de contrôle doivent pleinement respecter le droit international des droits humains, et les rapports de surveillance sont partagés avec les instances compétentes sur demande.

name: Right to Life
content: Every human being has the inherent right to life. This right must be protected by law, ensuring that no one is arbitrarily deprived of their life.
translation: Tout être humain a un droit inhérent à la vie. Ce droit doit être protégé par la loi, et nul ne peut être arbitrairement privé de sa vie.
citation_treaty: International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights

name: Right to Health
content: The right to the highest attainable standard of physical and mental health includes access to medical services, sanitation, adequate food, and nutrition.
translation: Le droit à la santé au plus haut niveau atteignable comprend l'accès aux services médicaux, à l'assainissement, à une alimentation suffisante et à une bonne nutrition.
citation_treaty: International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights

name: Right to Education
content: Everyone has the right to education. Primary education shall be compulsory and available free to all. Secondary and higher education shall be made accessible to all by every appropriate means.
translation: Toute personne a droit à l’éducation. L’instruction primaire doit être obligatoire et gratuite pour tous. L’enseignement secondaire et supérieur doit être accessible à tous par tous les moyens appropriés.
citation_treaty: International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights

name: Right to Adequate Housing
content: Everyone has the right to an adequate standard of living, including adequate housing. The state must take appropriate steps to ensure access to safe, secure, and habitable shelter for all persons.
translation: Toute personne a droit à un niveau de vie suffisant, y compris à un logement convenable. L’État doit prendre les mesures appropriées pour garantir un accès à un abri sûr, sécurisé et habitable pour tous.
citation_treaty: International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights

name: Right to Freedom of Expression
content: Every person has the right to hold opinions without interference and to seek, receive, and impart information and ideas through any media and regardless of frontiers. This right is fundamental for democracy, transparency, and civic participation.
translation: Toute personne a le droit d’exprimer librement ses opinions, sans interférence, et de rechercher, recevoir et diffuser des informations et des idées par tout moyen d’expression, sans considération de frontières. Ce droit est fondamental pour la démocratie, la transparence et la participation civique.
source: International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights

name: Duty to Pay Taxes
content: Citizens have a legal obligation to contribute financially to the operation of the state through the payment of taxes. This duty supports public services, infrastructure, and social protections, forming the economic foundation of a functioning government.
translation: Les citoyens ont l'obligation légale de contribuer au financement des fonctions de l'État par le paiement des impôts. Ce devoir soutient les services publics, les infrastructures et la protection sociale, constituant ainsi la base économique d’un gouvernement opérationnel.

name: Right to Education
content: Everyone has the right to education, which should be free at least at the elementary levels. Higher education shall be equally accessible based on merit. Education must aim at the full development of the human personality and dignity.
translation: Toute personne a droit à l'éducation, qui doit être gratuite au moins au niveau élémentaire. L'enseignement supérieur doit être également accessible selon le mérite. L'éducation doit viser au plein épanouissement de la personnalité humaine et à la dignité.
source: International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights

name: Obligation to Respect Human Rights of Others
content: Individuals and groups must respect the fundamental rights and freedoms of others, including their dignity, equality, and liberty. This obligation ensures peaceful coexistence and mutual recognition within society and across communities.
translation: Les individus et les groupes doivent respecter les droits fondamentaux et les libertés d’autrui, y compris leur dignité, égalité et liberté. Cette obligation garantit une coexistence pacifique et une reconnaissance mutuelle au sein de la société.

name: Right to Asylum
content: Everyone has the right to seek and to enjoy asylum from persecution in other countries. This right protects individuals from threats to life, liberty, and well-being in their home countries due to conflict, repression, or danger.
translation: Toute personne a le droit de chercher asile et de bénéficier de la protection contre la persécution dans d’autres pays. Ce droit protège contre les menaces à la vie, à la liberté et au bien-être causées par les conflits, la répression ou le danger dans le pays d'origine.

name: Right to Clean Air
content: Every person has the right to breathe clean, safe air. Governments must regulate pollution sources, monitor air quality, and ensure that no group suffers disproportionate harm from environmental degradation.
translation: Chaque personne a le droit de respirer un air propre et sain. Les gouvernements doivent réglementer les sources de pollution, surveiller la qualité de l'air et protéger toutes les populations contre la dégradation environnementale.

name: Duty to Serve on a Jury
content: Citizens have the duty to participate in jury service when called, helping ensure that justice is administered fairly and impartially through a process that reflects community values and legal standards.
translation: Les citoyens ont le devoir de participer à un jury lorsqu’ils sont appelés, afin de garantir une justice équitable et impartiale, en accord avec les valeurs communautaires et les normes juridiques.

name: Right to Digital Privacy
content: All individuals have the right to control their personal data and digital identity. Public and private entities must collect, store, and process data only with informed consent and transparency.
translation: Toute personne a le droit de contrôler ses données personnelles et son identité numérique. Les entités publiques et privées doivent gérer ces données avec consentement éclairé et transparence.

name: Duty to Protect the Environment
content: Each person and institution has a duty to minimize their environmental impact, preserve ecosystems, reduce waste, and act sustainably for the well-being of current and future generations.
translation: Chaque individu et institution a le devoir de réduire son impact environnemental, de préserver les écosystèmes, de limiter les déchets et d’agir de manière durable pour les générations présentes et futures.

name: Right to Internet Access
content: Access to the internet is a fundamental enabler of education, participation, and information. Governments must work to ensure equitable, affordable access across urban and rural communities.
translation: L'accès à Internet est essentiel pour l'éducation, la participation et l’information. Les gouvernements doivent garantir un accès équitable et abordable, tant dans les zones urbaines que rurales.

name: Duty to Defend the Democratic Process
content: Citizens must respect, uphold, and actively defend democratic institutions, voting processes, and the rule of law against manipulation, disinformation, or threats to legitimacy.
translation: Les citoyens doivent respecter, défendre et protéger les institutions démocratiques, les processus électoraux et l’état de droit contre toute manipulation, désinformation ou menace à leur légitimité.

name: Right to Clean Water and Sanitation
content: Everyone has the right to safe, accessible drinking water and adequate sanitation. Governments must invest in infrastructure and protect water sources from contamination and privatization.
translation: Chacun a droit à une eau potable sûre et accessible ainsi qu’à des installations sanitaires adéquates. L’État doit protéger les sources d’eau et assurer un accès équitable par l’infrastructure.

name: Duty to Report Corruption
content: All citizens and public servants have a duty to report acts of corruption, fraud, or abuse of power to appropriate oversight bodies. Protection for whistleblowers must be guaranteed.
translation: Tous les citoyens et agents publics ont le devoir de signaler les actes de corruption, fraude ou abus de pouvoir aux autorités compétentes. La protection des lanceurs d’alerte est essentielle.

name: Right to Decent Work
content: Every individual has the right to fair, safe, and dignified employment. This includes just remuneration, freedom from forced labor, and the ability to unionize and negotiate.
