translation: Chaque individu a droit à un travail équitable, sûr et digne. Cela comprend une rémunération juste, la liberté syndicale et la protection contre le travail forcé.

name: Duty to Register Vital Life Events
content: It is a legal duty to register births, deaths, marriages, and other vital events with the appropriate authorities. This ensures access to services and legal protections for all individuals.
translation: Il est obligatoire d’enregistrer les naissances, décès, mariages et autres événements civils auprès des autorités compétentes, afin de garantir l’accès aux droits et services pour tous.

name: Ombudsmanship
content:
The state shall establish an independent Ombudsmanship to uphold transparency, fairness, and legality across all sectors of governance. As a constitutionally grounded institution, the Ombudsman’s authority extends to monitoring all ministries and public agencies, including the stewardship of lands and resources. The institution shall have investigative, advisory, and prosecutorial powers to assess the misuse of public funds, ensure fair administration of justice, and combat corruption at all levels. Protected from political interference, the Ombudsmanship acts in the public interest and collaborates with civil society, judicial authorities, and international transparency bodies. Its findings shall be made public except where doing so would compromise the dignity or safety of protected persons. The institution shall have guaranteed access to governmental records and enforceable mechanisms to compel testimony and document submission. It serves not only as a guardian of the rule of law but as an engine of democratic accountability and public trust.
  1. Conduct random and risk-based audits of public agencies and ministries.
  2. Publish quarterly and annual reports of findings, accessible to the public.
  3. Receive and investigate confidential whistleblower complaints.
  4. Refer criminal matters to judicial authorities and initiate independent prosecutions where necessary.
  5. Maintain a permanent office in every administrative region with full-time staff and investigative authority.
translation: L'État établit une institution indépendante nommée Défenseur du Peuple afin de garantir la transparence, l'équité et la légalité dans l'administration publique. Ancrée constitutionnellement, cette autorité est habilitée à surveiller toutes les institutions ministérielles, y compris les domaines publics et les ressources nationales. Le Défenseur du Peuple détient les pouvoirs d’enquête, de conseil, et de poursuite nécessaires pour détecter les abus de fonds publics, assurer une justice administrative équitable, et lutter contre la corruption à tous les niveaux. Protégée de toute influence politique, cette institution œuvre dans l’intérêt public et coopère avec la société civile, les autorités judiciaires, et les organes internationaux de transparence. Ses rapports sont publics sauf en cas de risque pour la sécurité ou la dignité de personnes protégées. Elle dispose d’un droit d’accès aux documents administratifs et d’un pouvoir de contrainte pour recueillir des témoignages. Elle incarne la garde du droit et la conscience démocratique de la République.

name: Business Administration and Regulation Act
content: This law establishes the National Agency for Business Administration (NABA) under the Ministry of the Economy. NABA is responsible for overseeing the registration, regulation, and taxation of businesses. It provides a centralized digital platform for entrepreneurs to register, update, and manage business compliance. The law defines licensing requirements, reporting obligations, and tax categories with deadlines. It ensures transparency, reduces bureaucratic burden, and promotes fair competition through streamlined oversight.

name: Business Registration Procedure
content: All entities operating commercially must register with the National Agency for Business Administration (NABA) prior to commencing operations. Registration may be completed online or in person. Required documentation includes: owner identification, business structure (sole proprietorship, partnership, corporation, etc.), operating address, and nature of activity. A standard processing period of 5 working days applies. Registration certificates must be renewed every 5 years.

name: Business Licensing and Sectoral Regulations
content: Certain sectors—such as food services, construction, finance, and healthcare—require additional licenses from relevant authorities. NABA maintains a central database of licensing requirements and helps coordinate multi-agency approvals. Businesses must display all required licenses publicly and renew them annually. Operating without a license incurs fines and possible closure orders. Licensing fees are capped and indexed to inflation annually.

name: Business Taxation and Classification
content: Businesses are classified for tax purposes as micro (revenue < 50,000), small (50,000–500,000), medium (500,000–5M), or large (>5M) enterprises. Corporate income tax rates are progressive: 10% for micro, 15% for small, 20% for medium, and 25% for large enterprises. VAT applies at a standard rate of 12%, with exemptions for basic food and health goods. Taxpayer classification is reviewed annually by NABA.

name: Tax Filing and Deadlines
content: All businesses must submit annual tax returns by March 31st for the previous fiscal year. Quarterly VAT filings are due on the 15th of April, July, October, and January. Failure to file incurs escalating penalties: 1% of estimated liability after 15 days, 2% after 30 days, and suspension of business status after 60 days. Extensions of up to 30 days are available for documented hardship. NABA provides digital reminders and pre-filled forms via its online portal.

name: Compliance Audits and Enforcement
content: NABA conducts random and risk-based audits of registered businesses. High-risk indicators include late filings, unexplained revenue spikes, and reports of unsafe practices. Penalties for non-compliance range from warnings to fines, license suspension, or referral for prosecution. All audit findings are published in anonymized quarterly reports. Businesses may appeal findings through an administrative review process.

name: Crimes Against the Economy
content:
This law criminalizes business practices that undermine economic integrity, fair competition, and public trust in financial systems. Offenses include:
  1. Insider Trading: The act of buying or selling securities based on material, nonpublic information about the company, violating the duty of confidentiality owed to the company or its shareholders.
  2. Market Manipulation: Engaging in practices that distort the true price of securities or commodities to create an artificial market, including wash trading, painting the tape, and cornering the market.
  3. Fraudulent Corporate Reporting: The intentional misrepresentation of a company's financial condition, including falsifying financial statements, misstatements, or omissions of key facts, with the intent to deceive stakeholders.
  4. Bid Rigging: A form of collusion where competing parties agree to manipulate the bidding process for contracts, leading to predetermined outcomes that undermine competitive bidding.
  5. Abuse of Bankruptcy Protections: Exploiting bankruptcy laws to gain unfair advantages, such as hiding assets, making false declarations, or engaging in fraudulent transfers to avoid legitimate creditors.

name: Mandatory Job Posting Platform
content: All public and private employers are required to utilize a designated online platform for posting job openings. The platform must be accessible to all citizens, ensuring that every job opportunity is publicly advertised and easily accessible. Employers are mandated to post all job openings on this platform before seeking candidates through any other recruitment methods. The platform shall include relevant information regarding job descriptions, required qualifications, application procedures, and deadlines. Employers who fail to comply with this posting requirement may be subject to penalties, including fines or restrictions on their ability to hire new employees. The platform must also provide tools for job seekers to filter listings based on criteria such as location, job type, and required qualifications. Additionally, the Ministry of Labor and Employment will oversee the platform's operation to ensure compliance and address any issues that arise. The intent of this law is to promote transparency, equal access to job opportunities, and fairness in the hiring process, ultimately fostering a more equitable labor market for all individuals seeking employment.

name: Public Request for Labor Process
content: All employers are required to submit a formal request to the Ministry of Labor and Employment when seeking labor for any job positions. This request must include detailed information about the roles needed, including job descriptions, required qualifications, anticipated duration of employment, and the number of positions available. The Ministry will review all submissions to ensure compliance with labor regulations and equal employment opportunities. Upon approval, the Ministry will facilitate the posting of these job openings on the designated online platform. Employers are encouraged to outline their hiring preferences, including considerations for diversity and inclusion, to promote equitable opportunities for all applicants. This public request process aims to ensure that all labor needs are addressed systematically while providing transparency in hiring practices. Failure to adhere to this requirement may result in penalties, including fines or restrictions on future hiring activities. Additionally, this law seeks to enhance collaboration between employers and the Ministry, fostering an environment that supports workforce development and responds to the labor market's changing needs.

name: Demographic Reporting Requirements
content: Employers are required to collect and report demographic data for all candidates who apply for positions through the designated online job posting platform. This data must include information regarding the race, gender, age, and other relevant demographics of each applicant, as well as those who are ultimately selected for employment. The purpose of this requirement is to monitor and promote diversity and inclusion within the workforce and to ensure compliance with equal employment opportunity laws. Employers must submit this demographic data to the Ministry of Labor and Employment on a quarterly basis. The Ministry will aggregate this information to analyze trends in hiring practices and identify any disparities that may exist. Employers are also encouraged to implement outreach efforts to underrepresented groups in their recruitment strategies. Non-compliance with this reporting requirement may lead to penalties, including fines and potential legal actions. By ensuring that demographic data is collected and analyzed, this law aims to foster a more equitable hiring process and to promote accountability among employers in their efforts to enhance workplace diversity.

name: Fair Employment Practices
content: No employer shall engage in discriminatory practices in hiring, promotion, or compensation based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetic information. This law requires employers to adopt fair employment practices that ensure equal opportunities for all job seekers and employees. Employers must provide training for management and staff on recognizing and preventing discrimination and must establish internal procedures for addressing complaints of discriminatory practices. Additionally, employers are required to report demographic data related to their hiring processes to the Ministry of Labor and Employment annually, demonstrating their commitment to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Any violation of this law, including retaliatory actions against employees who report discrimination, may result in severe penalties, including fines, mandatory training programs, and potential revocation of business licenses. The law is designed to protect the rights of all employees and applicants, fostering an inclusive work environment where every individual is valued and given the opportunity to succeed based on merit. The Ministry will oversee compliance and provide resources to assist employers in meeting these requirements.

name: Workplace Safety Regulations
content: Employers must adhere to stringent workplace safety regulations designed to protect the health and safety of their employees. These regulations require employers to conduct regular safety audits of their facilities and practices, ensuring that all potential hazards are identified and mitigated. Employers are mandated to provide appropriate safety training for employees, equipping them with the knowledge and skills necessary to perform their jobs safely. Furthermore, employers must implement and maintain safety protocols, including emergency procedures, proper use of equipment, and reporting mechanisms for unsafe conditions. Non-compliance with these safety regulations may result in significant penalties, including fines and mandatory corrective action plans. The Ministry of Labor and Employment will conduct inspections to ensure compliance and will provide resources and guidance to assist employers in creating a safe work environment. This law aims to reduce workplace accidents and injuries, promote a culture of safety, and ensure that employees can perform their duties without the threat of harm. By fostering safe working conditions, this law supports the overall well-being of the workforce.

name: Establishment of the National Currencies
content:
1. This law establishes two national currencies: the Civic Unit (🝗) and the Citizen Share ().
  2. These currencies serve distinct but complementary functions: the former as legal tender and medium of exchange, and the latter as a symbolic and tradable share in the nation’s wealth.
  3. The value, issuance, and legal properties of both currencies are governed by subsequent sections of this law.
translation:
1. Ĉi tiu leĝo establas du naciajn valutojn: la Civika Unuo (🝗) kaj la Civitana Akcio ().
  2. Tiuj valutoj havas malsamajn sed komplementajn funkciojn: la unua kiel laŭleĝa pagilo kaj interŝanĝilo, la dua kiel simbolo kaj komerca parto de la riĉeco de la nacio.
  3. La valoro, emisio kaj laŭleĝaj atributoj de ambaŭ valutoj estas regataj per la sekvaj sekcioj de ĉi tiu leĝo.

name: Civic Unit (🝗) as Legal Tender
content:
1. The Civic Unit (🝗) is the legal tender of the state and shall be accepted in all transactions involving the payment of taxes, public services, and private obligations within the national territory.
  2. It is issued and regulated by the Central Bank under transparent and accountable mechanisms defined by law.
  3. The value of 🝗 is maintained through its exchangeability for essential public services and goods provided by the state.
translation:
1. La Civika Unuo (🝗) estas la laŭleĝa pagilo de la ŝtato kaj devas esti akceptata en ĉiuj transakcioj inkluzive de impostoj, publikaj servoj, kaj privataj ŝuldoj en la nacia teritorio.
  2. Ĝi estas eldonata kaj regulata de la Centra Banko laŭ travideblaj kaj respondece reguligitaj mekanismoj.
  3. La valoro de 🝗 estas konservata per ĝia interŝanĝeblo kontraŭ esencaj publikaj servoj kaj varoj provizitaj de la ŝtato.

name: Citizen Share () as Wealth Instrument
content:
1. The Citizen Share () represents a fractional equity in the net public assets of the state.
  2. Each citizen is entitled to receive one kilo at birth or upon naturalization, with naturalized citizens purchasing it at a fair market rate in 🝗.
  3.  is non-tradable until the recipient reaches the age of 18, after which it may be freely exchanged, gifted, or invested within state-sanctioned platforms.
translation:
1. La Civitana Akcio () reprezentas frakciecan parton de la neta publika riĉeco de la ŝtato.
  2. Ĉiu civitano ricevas unu plenan  je naskiĝo aŭ natura aliĝo, kun naturalizitaj civitanoj aĉetantaj ĝin je justa merkata valoro en 🝗.
  3.  ne estas komercebla ĝis la ricevanto atingas la aĝon de 18 jaroj, post kio ĝi povas esti libere interŝanĝata, donacita aŭ investita kadre de ŝtataj platformoj.

name: Currency Unit System and Denominations
content:
1. The Civic Unit (🝗) shall use a metric system of sub- and superunits to ensure accessibility and precision in exchange.
  2. Subunits shall follow base-10 divisions: 1 🝗 = 10 deci🝗 = 100 centi🝗 = 1000 milli🝗.
  3. Superunits may be expressed as: 10 🝗 = 1 deca🝗, 100 🝗 = 1 hecto🝗, and 1000 🝗 = 1 kilo🝗, primarily for accounting and institutional use.
translation:
1. La Civika Unuo (🝗) uzos metran sistemon de sub- kaj superunuoj por certigi alireblecon kaj precizecon en interŝanĝoj.
  2. Subunuoj sekvos bazo-10 dividojn: 1 🝗 = 10 deci🝗 = 100 centi🝗 = 1000 mili🝗.
  3. Superunuoj estos: 10 🝗 = 1 deca🝗, 100 🝗 = 1 hekto🝗, kaj 1000 🝗 = 1 kilo🝗, ĉefe por kontado kaj institucia uzo.

name: Central Bank
content:
1. This Organic Law establishes the Central Bank as the sole issuer of the Civic Unit () and the regulator of monetary policy within the national economy.
  2. The Central Bank shall operate in the public interest, with an institutional design that ensures its autonomy, accountability, and transparency.
  3. Its responsibilities include safeguarding price stability, maintaining financial system resilience, and supporting full and sustainable employment in accordance with the dual mandate.
translation:
1. Ĉi tiu Organika Leĝo establas la Centran Bankon kiel la solan eldonanton de la Civika Unuo () kaj reguliganton de la mona politiko en la nacia ekonomio.
  2. La Centra Banko funkcios laŭ la publika intereso, kun institucia strukturo kiu certigas ĝian aŭtonomecon, respondecon kaj travideblecon.
  3. Ĝiaj respondecoj inkluzivas protekti prezan stabilecon, konservi la fortikecon de la financa sistemo, kaj subteni plenan kaj daŭrigeblan dungadon laŭ la duobla mandato.

name: Governance and Management of the Central Bank
content:
1. The Central Bank shall be governed by a Board of Governors composed of a Chair, a Vice-Chair, and up to five additional members.
  2. Appointments are made by the Head of State upon recommendation by an independent commission, subject to legislative confirmation.
  3. Each term shall last 7 years and be renewable once. Governors must not hold financial or political positions during or for two years following their term.
  4. The Board shall publish minutes of all meetings and maintain a public record of policy decisions.
translation:
1. La Centra Banko estas regata de Estraro de Guberniestroj, inkluzive Prezidanton, Vicprezidanton, kaj ĝis kvin aldonajn membrojn.
  2. Nomumoj estas farataj de la Ŝtatestro surbaze de rekomendo de sendependa komisiono kaj kun konfirmo de la leĝdona instanco.
  3. Ĉiu mandato daŭras 7 jarojn kaj povas esti renovigita unufoje. Guberniestroj ne rajtas havi financajn aŭ politikajn postenojn dum aŭ dum du jaroj post sia mandato.
  4. La Estraro publikigos protokolojn de ĉiuj kunsidoj kaj konservos publikan registron de deciditaj politikoj.

name: Guarantees of Independence
content:
1. The Central Bank shall be institutionally and operationally independent from all other branches of government.
  2. Its funding shall be automatically allocated via a fixed share of GDP, not subject to discretionary budgetary control.
  3. No authority may direct or influence the Bank’s decisions regarding monetary policy, issuance, or financial stability operations.
  4. Accountability shall be ensured through periodic reporting to the legislature and mandatory public disclosures.
translation:
1. La Centra Banko estas institucie kaj funkcie sendependa de ĉiuj aliaj ŝtataj branĉoj.
  2. Ĝia financado estas aŭtomate asignita laŭ fiksa parto de MEP, sen submetiĝo al buĝeta diskreteco.
  3. Neniu aŭtoritato rajtas direkti aŭ influi decidojn de la Banko rilate monan politikon, emisiojn aŭ operaciojn por financa stabileco.
  4. Respondeco estas certigita per periodaj raportoj al la parlamento kaj devigaj publikaj diskonigoj.

name: The Dual Mandate
content:
1. The Central Bank shall pursue a dual mandate: (1) to maintain stable prices, and (2) to support full and sustainable employment.
  2. In the event of conflicting objectives, the Bank shall prioritize long-term sustainability and equity over short-term indicators.
  3. The dual mandate shall be operationalized through adaptive interest rate policies, open market operations, and cooperative planning with fiscal authorities.
  4. Progress toward mandate goals shall be transparently measured and reported quarterly.
translation:
1. La Centra Banko havas duoblan mandaton: (1) konservi prezan stabilecon kaj (2) subteni plenan kaj daŭrigeblan dungadon.
  2. En kazo de konfliktantaj celoj, la Banko prioritatos longtempan daŭripovon kaj egalecon super mallongdaŭraj indikiloj.
  3. La duobla mandato estas efektivigata per adaptemaj interezpolitikoj, malfermitmerkataj operacioj, kaj kunlabora planado kun la fiskaj aŭtoritatoj.
  4. Progreso rilate al la mandato estas mezurata kaj raportata kvaronjare kun plena travideblo.

name: Organic Law of the Public Housing Agency
content:
1. A Public Housing Agency is hereby established under the authority of Ministry 12 to ensure the right to dignified housing for all residents.
  2. The Agency shall construct, manage, and maintain public housing across all regions of the nation, ensuring equitable access.
  3. All residents are guaranteed access to public housing if needed, subject to application and availability standards based on vulnerability and income.
  4. Rent in public housing shall be capped at the greater of 𝝕1000 or 10% of monthly household income.
  5. The Agency shall promote long-term affordability and homeownership through progressive investment in housing cooperatives and transitional ownership models.

name: Organic Law of the Land Bank
content:
1. A Land Bank is hereby created under the jurisdiction of the Public Housing Agency and in collaboration with Ministry 77, tasked with acquiring, holding, and distributing land for housing and community development.
  2. The Land Bank shall issue subsidized loans to qualified individuals or cooperatives for the purchase of homes or development of residential land, prioritizing affordability, sustainability, and social utility.
  3. Loans issued by the Land Bank shall carry interest rates below prevailing market levels, and shall include grace periods and income-based repayment schedules.
  4. Land acquired by the Bank may also be leased under long-term, renewable agreements with fixed low-cost conditions for use in cooperative and nonprofit housing projects.
  5. Oversight of the Land Bank shall be subject to public audit and policy review by the relevant ministries.

name: Organic Law of the National Development Bank
content:
1. The National Development Bank (NDB) is hereby established as a public-private institution focused on long-term economic development and strategic national investment projects.
  2. The NDB shall be capitalized and majority-owned (no less than 51%) by the National Bank, with the remaining shares optionally available for public and institutional investment.
  3. The primary objectives of the NDB are to finance infrastructure, industrial modernization, innovation, and regional development, especially in underserved areas.
  4. The NDB shall operate under an independent board, with public interest obligations, and may engage in partnerships, credit guarantees, and equity investment under approved mandates.
  5. The corporate structure shall include a Board of Governors appointed by the state, a professional executive board, and regular audits. All actions must comply with applicable financial regulations.

name: Organic Law of the National Investment Bank
content:
1. The National Investment Bank (NIB) is hereby created to facilitate large-scale domestic and foreign investment aligned with the national development strategy.
  2. The NIB shall have a dual ownership structure with the National Bank holding at least 60% of shares, and the remainder open to public offering.
  3. The purpose of the NIB includes project financing, venture capital, green energy initiatives, and strategic economic partnerships, with oversight to prevent speculative misuse.
  4. The NIB shall maintain strict compliance with risk management principles and shall publish annual reports on its portfolio, returns, and social impact outcomes.
  5. Its corporate structure shall include an Executive Board, Investment Committee, and Advisory Council, with appointments based on competence and nonpartisan merit.

name: Affordable and Effective Public Health Care
content:
1. All legal residents of the state who are working, studying, minors, or of retirement age are guaranteed the right to affordable and effective public health care services.
  2. Access to care shall include preventative, primary, urgent, maternal, mental, and rehabilitative services delivered by the national health system or its authorized providers.
  3. All citizens diagnosed with a chronic illness, regardless of location of diagnosis, are entitled to full financial coverage of medically necessary treatment related to that condition.
  4. The public health system shall be organized to ensure timely care, continuity of treatment, and territorial equity in service access.

name: Guarantee of Life-Saving Care Regardless of Status
content:
1. The state shall provide full and immediate coverage for any life-saving medicine, procedure, or care to any individual, regardless of legal or immigration status.
  2. This right shall apply to any person whose life-threatening condition or illness first occurred or was contracted within the territory of the state.
  3. No administrative barrier shall delay access to emergency services under this guarantee.
  4. All public and private hospitals operating within the national territory are required to comply with this obligation without discrimination.

name: Fiscal Balancing and Countercyclical Policy Act
content:
1. The state shall operate under a principle of countercyclical fiscal policy, whereby budget deficits are permitted during economic downturns and surpluses are required during periods of economic expansion.
  2. The State Treasury shall annually evaluate key macroeconomic indicators including GDP growth, employment levels, inflation, and household income to determine the fiscal phase of the economy.
  3. Automatic stabilizers, such as progressive tax brackets and indexed social benefits, shall adjust revenue and expenditures in real time to reflect changing economic conditions.
  4. A Structural Fiscal Balance Formula shall be maintained to guide long-term budget neutrality across the economic cycle, calculated as:
    Net Balance = Core Revenue – Core Expenditure ± Stabilization Factor
  5. In periods of economic turbulence, temporary stimulus programs may be introduced to stabilize demand, with a requirement that resulting debt be paid down through primary surpluses in subsequent growth phases.
  6. All future budgets shall be reviewed for compliance with this framework by an independent Fiscal Stability Board reporting to Parliament.

name: State Treasury
content:
1. A State Treasury is hereby established as an autonomous institution under the supervision of the Ministry of the Economy, tasked with overseeing the management of public finances and ensuring fiscal sustainability.
  2. The Treasury shall manage the state’s revenue, expenditure, debt, and fiscal balance, and shall be the official reporting authority for public accounts and macroeconomic forecasting.
  3. It shall be responsible for drafting the national budget in accordance with the Fiscal Balancing and Countercyclical Policy Act, and for ensuring all public spending is consistent with long-term fiscal stability.
  4. The Treasury shall maintain a Structural Fiscal Balance Model, monitor automatic stabilizers, and implement stabilization measures during economic downturns, while generating surpluses during expansions to reduce public debt.
  5. It may propose emergency fiscal responses, including stimulus or austerity measures, subject to legislative approval, and shall ensure transparent accounting, audit procedures, and annual public reports.
  6. The Treasury shall operate independently from political interference, under the governance of a Fiscal Commissioner confirmed by Parliament, serving a single, non-renewable term of ten years.
  7. All departments and agencies must report projected and actual revenues and expenditures to the Treasury in a standardized and timely format.
  8. The Treasury may establish regional offices to coordinate with local governments and ensure integrated national fiscal management.

name: Justice and Adjudication
content: To adjudicate and to protect and enforce the rights, duties, and obligations of the state, ensuring legal order, equity, and access to justice through an independent judiciary and accessible court system.

name: Court System
content:
1. A system of courts is hereby established under the supreme authority of the High Court to interpret, enforce, and adjudicate matters of law within the jurisdiction of the state.
  2. The High Court shall serve as the final arbiter in all legal disputes, and shall supervise the structure and conduct of all lower courts.
  3. Courts shall ensure the equal and impartial application of laws, and uphold the foundational rights, duties, and obligations of the state.

name: Structure of the Judiciary and Subsidiary Courts
content:
1. The High Court shall be composed of an odd number of Justices, not fewer than five and not more than fifteen, to prevent deadlock in decision-making.
  2. The High Court or the Assembly may propose the creation of subsidiary courts of specialized or general jurisdiction.
  3. No subsidiary court may be established without approval by both the High Court and the Assembly.
  4. The jurisdiction, procedure, and rules of such courts shall be defined in law, and subject to oversight by the High Court.

name: Appointment and Tenure of Justices
content:
1. Justices of the High Court shall be nominated by the Assembly and confirmed by a two-thirds vote of participating citizens in the Assembly.
  2. Justices shall serve single, non-renewable terms of twenty years, unless removed for cause following formal procedure.
  3. Lower court judges shall be appointed according to procedures defined by law and approved by both the Assembly and High Court.
  4. All judges must meet qualifications of legal experience, civic integrity, and demonstrated impartiality.

name: Principles of Objectivity and Equity
content:
1. All courts and justices shall act according to the principles of objectivity, equity, and constitutional supremacy.
  2. Legal interpretation must consider the spirit and purpose of laws, and safeguard the balance between individual rights and the public good.
  3. All citizens, residents, and legal persons shall have equal standing before the law, and access to transparent legal remedy.

name: Democracy
content: To establish and protect a democratic political system in which citizens participate directly in lawmaking and oversight through institutional frameworks grounded in civics, legal and political education, and deliberative self-government.

name: Establishment of the Assembly
content:
1. An Assembly is hereby established as the principal legislative body of the state, composed of all citizens aged sixteen or older who have completed the required civic education and passed the state civic examination.
  2. Each qualified citizen shall have an equal vote and the right to propose, amend, and debate laws.
  3. The Assembly shall function continuously through secure digital platforms and periodic in-person gatherings as necessary.

name: Civics Education and State Examination
content:
1. The Ministries of Education and Justice shall jointly design and administer comprehensive civic education programs covering law, government, ethics, history, political philosophy, and the functioning of the state.
  2. Completion of this program and passing a standardized civic exam shall be required for full participation in the Assembly.
  3. The exam shall test legal, political, social, and moral competence, and be freely accessible and regularly available.

name: Structure of the Ministries
content:
1. Each Ministry shall be led by either a singular Executive Director or a Council of Executives, who act as the plenipotentiary head of that institution.
  2. These leaders shall be vested with the authority to implement, enforce, and administer policies and state responsibilities within their defined scope.
  3. The structure, appointment, and term of office for each Ministry's leadership shall be defined by law, subject to oversight by the Assembly.

name: Powers of the Assembly
content:
1. The Assembly may enact, amend, or repeal any law or policy within the state, subject to the limits of fundamental rights, duties, and obligations.
  2. It may delegate powers to Ministries to carry out executive and administrative functions derived from specific Purposes.
  3. With a supermajority vote, the Assembly may add, amend, or remove Purposes that define the scope of state powers and ministries.
  4. Ministries derive their jurisdiction and authority solely from the existence and definition of their associated Purposes.

name: Constitutional Limits and Court Oversight
content:
1. The Assembly shall not pass any law that violates established rights, duties, and obligations without due constitutional process.
  2. The High Court may strike down any Assembly decision that breaches these foundational elements.
  3. However, the Assembly may override such decisions by a supermajority vote of its full citizenry.
  4. This ensures a balance between democratic sovereignty and the preservation of foundational principles.

name: State Technology Innovation Agency
content:
1. The State Technology Innovation Agency is hereby established as an independent body charged with fostering technological advancement and system innovation in service of the state and the public good.
  2. The Agency shall design, develop, and maintain advanced technologies to support the functioning of laws, ministries, the Assembly, and state institutions.
  3. It shall create and maintain publicly accessible tools, applications, and platforms that improve transparency, civic engagement, and access to public services.
  4. The Agency shall research, design, and propose new models for governance, communication, and administration to enhance cohesion, harmony, simplicity, and operational efficiency across all branches and levels of the state.
  5. The Agency shall work in coordination with relevant ministries, the Assembly, and citizen input to guide its priorities and ensure responsiveness to evolving technological and democratic needs.
  6. The Agency is directly accountable to the Minister of Democracy.

name: Organic Law on the State Wealth Fund
content:
1. A State Wealth Fund is hereby established as a permanent sovereign investment vehicle, controlled and administered by the Central Bank.
  2. The Fund shall receive its revenues primarily from the wealth tax collected under applicable tax law, and may also receive extraordinary allocations from budget surpluses or natural resource profits.
  3. The purpose of the Fund is to build intergenerational wealth, ensure long-term macroeconomic stability, and support public investment in times of economic downturn, without creating inflationary pressure.
  4. The Fund shall be governed by an independent council appointed by the Central Bank, with oversight by the Assembly and annual public reporting obligations.
  5. Investments by the Fund shall be guided by principles of risk diversification, sustainability, ethical standards, and national strategic interests, with no more than 30% of assets invested in foreign markets unless otherwise approved by supermajority of the Assembly.
  6. The principal of the Fund shall be preserved in perpetuity; only a defined percentage of the average return over a rolling 5-year period may be spent annually to support the state budget or capital development projects.

name: National Tax Agency and National Tax System
content:
1. A National Tax Agency (NTA) is hereby established under the Ministry of the Economy to administer, collect, and enforce the national tax laws of the state. The NTA shall operate independently under a Director appointed by the Assembly, and is responsible for maintaining accurate records, reporting tax revenue, and supporting compliance and audits. The national tax system shall include the following components:
    1. Wealth Tax: An annual tax of 1% on net assets above 🝗10 million, assessed on individuals and families, with half of revenues allocated to the State Wealth Fund.
    2. Income Tax: A progressive marginal income tax on personal income: 0% on the first 🝗12,000/year, 10% on income from 🝗12,001 to 🝗40,000, 25% on income from 🝗40,001 to 🝗100,000, and 40% on income over 🝗100,000. Corporate income is taxed at a flat 20% rate on net profits.
    3. Value Added Tax (VAT): A 10% VAT is applied to the sale of goods and services, except on essential food, health, and educational items, which are zero-rated.
    4. Excise Taxes: High excise taxes are levied on tobacco, alcohol, fossil fuels, and luxury goods, to promote public health and environmental responsibility.
    5. Import Tariff: A 5% tariff is levied on imported goods, with a de minimis threshold of 🝗100 for individual shipments below which no tariff is assessed.
    The NTA shall ensure all taxes are collected equitably, digitally recorded, and published in transparent annual summaries for public accountability.
